required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Vitamin A Value of Spirulina Carotenoids in Humans
clinical_study.official_title: Vitamin A Value of Spirulina Carotenoids in Humans

brief_summary.textblock: The goal of this protocol is to determine the vitamin A value (equivalence) of spirulina. The investigation will use intrinsically deuterium labeled spirulina and an isotope vitamin A reference dose, 13C10- retinyl acetate (13C10 RAc), in males (n=20). Up to 45 blood samples (10 ml/sample) will be collected from each subject over a two-month period to evaluate the bioavailability and bioconversion of spirulina ß-carotene to vitamin A.

primary_outcome.measure: The enrichment of spirulina ß-carotene and its cleavage product vitamin A were tracked after taken the oral dose of intrinsically labeled spirulina.

intervention.description: an acute dose of spirulina up to 5 g
vitamin A value of spirulina ß-carotene

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy volunteer
Exclusion Criteria:
- Not has GI track problems
- Any medical condition that will affect the intestinal absorption

overall_official.affiliation: USDA Human Nutrition Research Center on Aging, Tufts University

facility.name: USDA Human Nutrition Research Center on Aging, Tufts Uni.
